Description: Rim sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style pottery chalice; discoloured white slip; interior: reserved band at rim, glazed streaky black below; part of lotus flower in added white outline with added red centres above two faded white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of sphinx (only part of head and front of wing remaining) to left; pendant and rising triangles and elaborate rosette as filling ornament; lip decoration mostly worn.
Curator's comments: Lemos describes the sherd as belonging to the Group of Light-Walled Naukratis Animal Chalices. All sherds in this group are small and offer very little by way of information beyond the fact that they come from light-walled chalices. The decoration on sherds belonging to this group is also poorly or carelessly drawn (Lemos 1991, 93).
Bibliographic references: Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 93, p. 258, no. 489, pl. 65)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0550) (phase 2)
